description: Dive into "Hyderabad's Architectural Wonders Await" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Hyderabad's Architectural Wonders Await

places.generalDescription: Birla Mandir is an impressive Hindu temple situated on a hilltop, constructed with white marble and adorned with towers, shrines, and intricate interior carvings. Nearby, visitors can also explore the Birla Science Center, which includes a planetarium offering a 3D theatre experience and an observatory. The center also features a science museum with interactive exhibits focused on physics, optical illusions, environmental studies, and more ‚Äì making it an engaging destination for science enthusiasts of all ages.

sources.snippet: Pristine white, taller than the tallest of the city and magnificently lit, such is the splendour of the Birla Mandir of Hyderabad. Being in south India the architecture and the structure of the temple is more or less along the lines of South Indian architectural styles. Made of the complete marble, the temple is dedicated to Lord Venkateshwara.
sources.shortName: 19 Hyderabad Monuments | Historical Monuments in Hyderabad

places.name: Birla Temple

reviews.text: This temple is such a peaceful spot right in the middle of the city. Evenings are the best time to visit there's something really calming about the cool breeze, the view of the city, and Hussain Sagar in the distance. It's a great place to just sit and unwind.

A truly magnificent temple with a beautiful location. It offers free parking, a dedicated mobile stand, and a shoe stand for visitors convenience. Cameras are not allowed inside, which adds to the peaceful and spiritual atmosphere. The surroundings are calm and serene, making it a perfect place for meditation and relaxation. There is no ticket system to enter temple

The best thing about this place is you get an aerial view of the city from the top of the temple.

Also, I felt a sense of peace and calmness and the presence of divine. I definitely recommend this place when in Hyderabad.

Note: you have to submit your phone and any electronic items before you enter the temple and I feel that makes your experience more divine.

places.address: Naubat Pahad, Ambedkar Colony, Khairtabad, Hyderabad, Telangana 500004, India

places.generalDescription: Charminar, a 16th-century mosque in Hyderabad, India, is an iconic architectural and cultural symbol of the city. Built by Mohammed Quli Qutb Shah to commemorate the end of epidemics caused by water shortage, this UNESCO World Heritage site stands tall amidst the vibrant Laad Bazaar. The massive structure features four grand arches facing cardinal points and 48-meter-tall minarets atop each column.

sources.snippet: The Four Minarets, also known as Charminar, is another monument built by the Qutb Shahi dynasty. There are many folklores about the true origin of this building with some suggesting that the structure was built to mark the end of an extremely deadly Cholera. There‚Äôs another interesting tale that Charminar was the spot where Qutb Shahi got the first glimpse of his future queen to be Rani Bhagmati.
sources.shortName: 12 Top Historical Places in Hyderabad with Location & Timings

sources.snippet: The Charminar is the most iconic building in Hyderabad and one of the most famous landmarks in India. The Charminar was built in 1591 by Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah, the fifth ruler of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. The monument stands at a height of 48.7 meters and is made of granite and lime mortar.
sources.shortName: Famous Buildings in Hyderabad: A Guide to the City‚Äôs Iconic Structures | by Kunal Pardeshi

places.name: Charminar

reviews.text: ‚ÄãThe Charminar is the heart of Hyderabad, a magnificent monument steeped in history. Its iconic four arches and intricate architecture are a sight to behold. The bustling market surrounding it offers a vibrant experience with a mix of street food and traditional wares. A must-visit to truly feel the city's pulse.

We recently visited the iconic Charminar. The recent restoration work has really brightened it up, giving it a fresh look that stands out beautifully in photos. You can go inside and climb up for a unique view of the surrounding area, which adds to the experience.
We went in the morning, which turned out to be a great choice, fewer people and much more comfortable weather. Just around the monument, the streets are alive with local vendors, colorful stalls, and the aroma of street food in the air. It's not just about history here; the area is full of life, with endless little shops offering a mix of budget-friendly items from handcrafted trinkets to stylish clothes.
Charminar isn't just a tourist spot, it truly captures the spirit of Hyderabad. Whether you're into heritage, food, or shopping, this place brings it all together in one unforgettable visit.

Recently, I had the chance to visit the iconic Charminar in Hyderabad, and I must say it was a wonderful experience. This historical monument truly lives up to its reputation as the heart of Hyderabad. The first thing that caught my attention was the sheer beauty of the structure ‚Äì its magnificent arches, minarets, and the overall grandeur that takes you back in time. It's not just a monument but an emotion for the city.

Although there was a huge crowd, I was impressed with how well the local authorities and the Government of Hyderabad managed the place. From cleanliness to crowd control, everything seemed organized, which allowed visitors like me to enjoy the site without any hassle.

The surroundings of Charminar are equally lively. There are countless mini shops and street stalls selling everything from colorful bangles, dresses, and shoes to small souvenirs that perfectly capture the essence of Hyderabad. For a food lover like me, this place is heaven. The lanes are filled with aromatic food stalls and restaurants serving delicious dishes, especially the famous Mandi, chicken delicacies, and Hyderabadi specialties that you just cannot miss.

Overall, my visit to Charminar was a blend of history, culture, and flavors. It's a place where tradition meets modernity, and every corner has something to offer. I would highly recommend everyone to visit this place at least once in their lifetime. Whether you love history, shopping, or food ‚Äì Charminar has it all.

places.address: Charminar Rd, Char Kaman, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002, India

places.generalDescription: Chowmahalla Palace, also known as The Four Palaces, is a historical gem in Hyderabad that served as the official seat of the Asaf Jahi Dynasty. Built in the 18th century, this opulent palace boasts magnificent Persian-style architecture reminiscent of the Shah Palace in Tehran, Iran. Its lush grounds feature gardens, fountains, and smaller palace structures.

sources.snippet: Sprawling courtyards, impeccable architecture and unending tourist footfall,  the Chowmahalla Palace in Hyderabad promise it all. Though only some parts of the palace are open to the public, yet they are enough to mesmerize the tourists with their sheer charm and grace. Believed to be the banquets for the Nizam in its time, this complex comprises for four sections namely the Mahtab Mahal, Aftab Mahal, Tahniyat Mahal and the Afzal Mahal.
sources.shortName: 19 Hyderabad Monuments | Historical Monuments in Hyderabad

sources.snippet: The Chowmahalla Palace is a palace that was the official residence of the Nizams of Hyderabad. The palace was built in the 18th century and is an excellent example of the fusion of different architectural styles. The palace comprises of four different courtyards, each with its own unique style and character.
sources.shortName: Famous Buildings in Hyderabad: A Guide to the City‚Äôs Iconic Structures | by Kunal Pardeshi

sources.snippet: Chowmahalla Palace | #5 of 12 Best Historical Places in Hyderabad. Built in the 18th century, Chowmahalla Palace was the center of governance for the Asaf Jahi dynasty and later served as the residence for the Nizams of Hyderabad. All the ceremonial functions were held at the palace.
sources.shortName: 12 Top Historical Places in Hyderabad with Location & Timings

sources.snippet: The Khilwat Mubarak, the Grand Durbar is something one should look out for. Its grandeur and charm give it a spot on our list. One of the finest examples of European neo-classical architecture in the city.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Hyderabad for the Travelling Architect -

places.name: Chowmahalla Palace

reviews.text: It's one of the major tourist attractions of Hyderabad with stunning architecture and beautiful landscape. It was the official Palace of Nizams during their reign which reflects the rich history of Hyderabad. The word Chowmahalla means four  palaces. Beautiful fountains and gardens are also a major attraction. They have a collection of vintage cars. The interior of the darbar hall is decorated with so many chandeliers, which gives unique style and elegance to this palace.

Decent Experience ‚Äì Highlight is the Vintage Car Collection

Visited Chowmahalla Palace, and overall it felt average. The first building with its architecture and interiors is worth seeing, but beyond that, not much stood out.

The best part of the visit was the collection of antique/vintage cars ‚Äì well-maintained and impressive. Other sections felt repetitive and lacked engaging displays.

Good for a short visit if you're nearby, but not a must-see unless you're a history or car enthusiast.

Minimum Paid Car / bike parking is available inside the palace boundaries.
For Indian 100/person ticket is there. Please make sure you have min 2hrs to visit the entire palace. Closing time sharp 5pm. No charges for photography. Free Toilet and water is available inside the palace.

places.address: 20-4-236, Moti Galli Rd, Khilwat, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002, India

places.generalDescription: Sanghi Temple is a stunning Hindu temple complex located approximately 25 kilometers from the heart of Hyderabad. Positioned atop Paramanand Giri, it showcases exquisite Chola-Chalukya architecture and is devoted to Lord Venkateshwara, featuring a striking replica of the revered Tirumala idol. The site also encompasses smaller shrines honoring various Hindu deities such as Goddess Kamalambika, Lord Shiva, and Lord Rama.

sources.snippet: About 35 KM from the city, this temple was completed in 1991 and displays Chola-Chalukya style of architecture. It is among the major spots for film shooting and is famous for its architecture.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Hyderabad for the Travelling Architect -

places.name: Sanghi Temple

reviews.text: The Sanghi Temple of Hyderabad, located on top of a hill, provides a sweeping view as well as its religious importance. Its unique South Indian architecture with richly sculpted gopurams and bright deities gives a visual treat. Different deities housed within the temple complex, each within its shrine, give the religious experience the range it offers. The peaceful environment, complimented by the hilltop location and tidy surroundings, promotes feelings of serenity and piety. The tidiness and structure of the temple add to an enjoyable visit, and the panoramas of the surrounding countryside complete the overall appeal. Though the ascent to the temple may be a little demanding, the synergy of religious comfort and aesthetic appeal makes the Sanghi Temple a favorite spot for locals as well as visitors looking for a serene getaway and an insight into South Indian temple architecture.

I recently again visited Sanghi Temple and had a wonderful experience. The place is peaceful, beautiful and clean surroundings. The fresh air and natural greenery create a calm and pleasant atmosphere. It's a great spot for both spiritual visits and relaxing away from the city. However, do check the timings before visiting. On Sundays, the temple is open until 7 PM, while on weekdays it may close after 12 PM and reopen around 3 PM.

peaceful atmosphere, beautiful architecture, and scenic views. Many visitors appreciate the temple's serene environment and the –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å enjoy the sunset views from the hilltop location. Some reviewers also note the presence of monkeys on the temple grounds, which can be a point of interest for some visitors.
Here's a more detailed look at the reviews:
Positive Aspects:
Peaceful and Serene:
Many reviews highlight the temple's peaceful and calm atmosphere, making it a good place for spiritual reflection.
Beautiful Architecture:
The temple's architecture, inspired by traditional designs, is frequently praised.
Scenic Views:
The temple's hilltop location provides panoramic views, especially during sunset, which is a popular time to visit.
Clean and Well-Maintained:
Some reviewers have noted the temple's cleanliness and well-maintained environment.
Accessibility:
The temple is relatively easy to reach, with good road access and parking facilities.
Limited Vendor Pestering:
One reviewer appreciated the absence of aggressive vendors or priests, allowing for a more peaceful worship experience.
Monkeys:
While some find the monkeys to be a nuisance, others enjoy them as a source of entertainment.
Potential Drawbacks:
Monkeys: As mentioned, the presence of monkeys can be a drawback for some visitors.
Limited Activities: Some reviewers note that there isn't much to do at the temple besides visiting and admiring the architecture and views.
Photography Restrictions: Photography may be restricted in certain areas of the temple.

places.address: Omerkhan Daira, Hyderabad, Telangana 501512, India

places.generalDescription: Hussain Sagar Lake, located in Hyderabad and Secunderabad, is a popular tourist destination. This man-made lake was constructed in 1562 to meet the water and irrigation needs of the city. It is surrounded by Lumbini Park, Indira Park, and Sanjeeviah Park. The centerpiece of the lake is a large Buddha statue situated on a rock.

sources.snippet: The Hussain Sagar Lake is a man-made lake that was built in the 16th century. The lake is surrounded by several parks, gardens and statue of Lord Buddha in the center of the lake. There are boating options and the lake has several parks and gardens to offer a perfect place for a picnic.
sources.shortName: Famous Buildings in Hyderabad: A Guide to the City‚Äôs Iconic Structures | by Kunal Pardeshi

places.name: Hussain Sagar

reviews.text: Most aesthetic and beautiful place in Hyderabad. Perfect for Aqua Babies! üíô beautiful sigh view at sunrise sunset and evening. You can enjoy the view whole day it has so many parks surrounded and cafes with water view. Parks and adventures. Lumbini park which has boat rides. You can take ride to buddha statue and see good view 360 degree. There is a park near by where theme wise fares are set up like summer fare, plants fare and more.

Hyderabad's perfect evening spot, the stretch along Hussain Sagar from the Ambedkar statue to the Secretariat feels like the city's own Marine Drive. Sunset views from Tank Bund Road, with the Buddha statue reflecting on the lake, are simply stunning.

Hussain Sagar is a beautiful and iconic lake located in the heart of Hyderabad, known for its serene atmosphere, historic significance, and the majestic Buddha statue that stands on an island in the middle of the lake.

Pros:

üèûÔ∏è Scenic View: The lake offers stunning views, especially at sunset.

üõ∂ Boating Experience: Great options for boating and ferry rides to the Buddha statue.

üåá Vibrant Atmosphere: Surrounded by Tank Bund and Necklace Road, which are popular hangout spots.

üì∏ Photogenic Location: Ideal for photography and relaxing evening strolls.

üõçÔ∏è Nearby Attractions: Close to Lumbini Park, Birla Mandir, and the city center.

Cons:

üóëÔ∏è Cleanliness Issues: Some areas around the lake can be cleaner.

üö¶ Traffic Congestion: Gets crowded during weekends and holidays.

ü¶ü Mosquitoes: Can be an issue in the evening due to the water body.

places.address: Hyderabad, Telangana

places.generalDescription: Golconda Fort, once the capital of a flourishing kingdom from the 14th to 16th century, boasts 87 semi-circular bastions. While Hyderabad is known for iconic attractions like Charminar and Chowmahalla and Falaknuma Palaces, there are also hidden gems to explore. The city offers diverse experiences beyond its famous museums and delicious Hyderabadi biryani.

sources.snippet: The fort that was completed in the 17 th century was the stronghold of the legendary Qutub Shahi Empire. One of the best examples of the acoustic systems of the age, this Hyderabad monument still does not fail to surprise the tourists with its extraordinary architecture and style. Quite the heart of the city‚Äôs mercantile activities, the place has forever been known to be a place of trading for the diamond merchants and other traders of gemstones.
sources.shortName: 19 Hyderabad Monuments | Historical Monuments in Hyderabad

sources.snippet: Another splendid example of Qutb Shahi architecture is Golconda Fort. Golconda has four distinct forts with a 10 km long outer wall surrounding them along with 87 semicircular bastions, four drawbridges, and gateways with several royal apartments & halls, temples, mosques, stables, etc. inside. The lowest of these is the outermost space into which we enter by the ‚ÄúFateh Darwaza‚Äù.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Hyderabad for the Travelling Architect -

sources.snippet: Golconda Fort | #1 of 12 Best Historical Places in Hyderabad. Formerly known as Mankal, Golconda fort was built by Kakatiya Kings and completed by Rani Rudrama and her successor Prataparudra. However, the structure that we see today was renovated by the Sultan Quli Qutb-ul-Mulk from Qutb Shahi dynasty, who chose Golconda to be the center of his governance.
sources.shortName: 12 Top Historical Places in Hyderabad with Location & Timings

sources.snippet: Located towards the western province of Hyderabad, the Golconda Fort was the capital of the Qutub Shahi Kings. It is assumed to be a 2000 years old structure. This fort is one of the most magnificent and massive fortress ever made and stands on a granite hill which is about 120 meters high giving a bird eye‚Äôs view of the city to the person standing on it.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Historic Places & Monuments in Hyderabad

places.name: Golconda Fort

reviews.text: Golconda Fort is a remarkable historical site.  Its impressive architecture and imposing stone structures are captivating, and the fort's rich history adds to its allure. While the climb to the summit can be demanding, the panoramic view of Hyderabad is a rewarding spectacle.  The unique acoustic system, demonstrable by clapping at the entrance and hearing the echo at the top, is noteworthy.For an enhanced experience, an evening visit is recommended to witness the light and sound show, which eloquently narrates the fort's history.  Given the extensive walking involved, comfortable shoes and water are essential.  Golconda Fort is a must-see destination for any visitor to Hyderabad.

I recently visited Golconda Fort in Hyderabad, and it was a wonderful experience filled with history, nature, and beautiful sights. The fort is well-maintained and attracts many visitors, especially on weekends. We observed a lot of youngsters and even foreign tourists exploring the area.

Please note, there is no food court inside the fort, so it's good to carry water or light snacks. The entry ticket costs ‚Çπ25, which is quite reasonable for such a historic and scenic place.

As we climbed to the top of the fort, the cool breeze and panoramic view of the city made the effort completely worth it. From the top, we could see a large part of Hyderabad. A special moment was witnessing a peacock dancing in the forested area below, which we spotted from the top - truly magical!

There are also two temples inside the fort area that add to its cultural charm:

A Yellamma temple, which looks beautiful and peaceful.

Another Mahankali temple, located near the top of the fort, which is especially impressive - it's carved from a single stone, and its architecture stands out.

Golconda Fort is truly massive - a big fort with stunning architecture and an impressive area that takes you back centuries. Walking through its gates and pathways gives a real sense of Hyderabad's rich history. The acoustic system and panoramic views from the top are remarkable.

That said, parts of the fort could have been restored better to preserve its grandeur. Some areas look neglected, which slightly takes away from the overall experience.

Still, it's a must-visit if you're in Hyderabad - both for the historical significance and the breathtaking views of the city. Go early morning or evening to avoid the heat and enjoy it fully.

places.address: Khair Complex, Ibrahim Bagh, Hyderabad, Telangana 500008, India

Creating modern interior design without a sell-by date. reviews.text: Impressed and satisfied with yellow olives professionalism and quality of work for our Duplex home. One of the interesting parts of this journey was when we were booked in for our Material Selections where we were amazed by the number of options which enabled us to visualise the finish of our home before the construction started. We were rest assured knowing that experienced experts are handling the build and were thrilled when the construction was completed ahead of time. Much appreciated for yellow olives dedication and looking forward to building with them again!
Good work, must recommend company for interiors
Thanks for providing great interior service for my new home. All my requests were done patiently with great quality. It was really great working with you Tarun

places.address: H No: 5-5-1158/50, Sri Sainath Colony, Vanasthalipuram, Hyderabad, Telangana 500070, India

places.generalDescription: Toli Masjid, also known as Damri Masjid, is a stunning mosque located just 2km from Golconda Fort. Legend has it that the royal architect, Mir Musa Khan Mahaldar, built this mosque using funds earned by receiving one damri for every rupee spent on constructing Mecca Masjid. Situated in the suburb of Karvan and built in 1671, Toli Masjid features a raised platform and two halls.

sources.snippet: Also known as Damri Masjid, Toli Masjid is only 2km from the Golconda Fort. Based on the folklore Mir Musa Khan, the royal architect, was given one damri (an old Indian currency) for every rupee spent on building Mecca Masjid, with which he made the Toli Masjid. This beautiful mosque is built on a raised platform and has two halls.
sources.shortName: 12 Top Historical Places in Hyderabad with Location & Timings

sources.snippet: Erected in 1671 by Mir Musa Khan Mahaldar, this mosque boasts of Indo-Islamic architecture. Built on a raised platform, this masjid has two spacious halls. In the outer hall, there are five arched openings, each of which is adorned with lotus medallions in the spandrels.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Hyderabad for the Travelling Architect -

places.name: Toli Masjid ŸπŸàŸÑ€å ŸÖÿ≥ÿ¨ÿØ

reviews.text:
üïå‚ú® Hidden Gem of Hyderabad ‚Äì Toli Masjid ‚ú®üïå

Did you know about the stunning Toli Masjid in Karwan, Hyderabad? Built in 1671 by Mohiuddin Mohammed during the reign of Sultan Abdullah Qutb Shah, this architectural beauty is a masterpiece of Qutb Shahi style! üòç

Also called the Damri Masjid, legend says the architect saved a damri (small coin) for every rupee spent on building the Mecca Masjid to construct this mosque! ü™ôüí´

With its towering minarets, intricate stucco work, and rich history, Toli Masjid is a must-visit for history lovers and heritage enthusiasts! üèõÔ∏èüì∏

Have you been to this lesser-known wonder? Share your thoughts! üí¨üëá

üìç Location: Karwan, Hyderabad
üï∞Ô∏è Best Time to Visit: Early mornings or evenings for that perfect shot! üåÖ

#hyderabadheritage #tolimasjid #damrimasjid #qutbshahiarchitecture #hiddengems #heritagesites #historicalplaces #explorehyderabad #incredibleindia #travelgram #mosquearchitecture #hyderabaddiaries #historyunveiled #historylovers #travelphotography #ancientarchitecture #heritagewalks #qutbshahidynasty #hyderabadhistory #indiatravel

Among the many heritage treasures of Hyderabad, Toli Masjid, also fondly known as Damri Masjid, stands out for its unique history and architectural charm. Built in 1671 by Musa Khan, the royal chamberlain and minister under Abdullah Qutb Shah, this mosque reflects both devotion and ingenuity. Musa Khan, who was also entrusted with overseeing the construction of the grand Makkah Masjid, is remembered for his generosity, every time he saved one Damri (a small coin) from the mosque's construction costs, he invested it in building this mosque. Hence, it came to be called the Damri Masjid.

Architecturally, the mosque is a true marvel of Qutb Shahi craftsmanship. Resting on an elevated platform, the structure features two tall minarets and four smaller ones, three graceful domes crowning the prayer hall, and five distinct archways leading into the sanctum. The symmetrical balance of arches, minarets, and domes showcases the elegance of Deccan architecture, blending simplicity with grandeur. The intricate stucco work and finely proportioned details mirror the Qutb Shahi style seen in Hyderabad's other great monuments.

Despite being less visited than the Charminar or Makkah Masjid, Toli Masjid remains an enduring reminder of devotion, humility, and artistic excellence. Its story of being born out of a chamberlain's savings adds a soul-stirring dimension to its beauty. Standing before this mosque, one realizes that true heritage is not just built of stone, but of faith, sacrifice, and timeless artistry.

The Toli Masjid is a flamboyant mosque, situated in the suburban area of Karvan, located nearly 2 km away from the Golconda fort. The masjid is one of the many gorgeous memorials in Hyderabad.

It is a breathtakingly beautiful example of the architecture of Qutb Shahi. The Toli masjid is embellished by two minarets of about 20 meters on either side. It was constructed in 1671 by Mir Musa Khan Mahaldar, the known and renowned designer of Qutb Shah.

The frontage of the Toli Masjid comprises of five arches, each of which consists of lotus decorations in the spandrels. The main arch is somewhat broader and more elaborate. As per the regal records, the Toli Masjid is also called as Damdi Masjid.

places.address: Karan Singh Marg, Kphs Colony, Ramsingh Pura, Girkapalli, Karwan East, Hyderabad, Telangana 500006, India

places.generalDescription: The Qutub Shahi Tombs, constructed in the 16th and 17th centuries, are a collection of ornate domed tombs built for the rulers of the Qutub Shahi dynasty. The site is part of a large archaeological park undergoing renovation by the Aga Khan Development Network. With 40 mausoleums, 23 mosques, a hammam, and pavilions set amidst landscaped gardens, it's an ambitious heritage project.

sources.snippet: The Qutb Shahi Tombs are situated about a kilometer away from Golconda fort and are very famously called as Seven Tombs. This place has the maximum number of tombs in one place, dedicated to the 7 great rulers and kings of the Qutb Shahi Dynasty who ruled the state of Hyderabad for about 170 years. The tombs vary from each other in size and design and some are built quite simple while others have intricate designs carved on them.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Historic Places & Monuments in Hyderabad

sources.snippet: Located just a short distance from the Charminar, the Qutb Shahi Tombs are a group of tombs belonging to the members of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. The tombs are surrounded by beautiful gardens and are built in the Persian-Islamic architectural style. Each tomb is adorned with intricate carvings and calligraphic inscriptions.
sources.shortName: Famous Buildings in Hyderabad: A Guide to the City‚Äôs Iconic Structures | by Kunal Pardeshi

sources.snippet: This place has quite significance in history as it is the final resting place of the Qutub Shahi rulers. Labeled to be one of the most regal tombs of the country, these tombs resemble the tombs of the Shah‚Äôs in Iran. One of the oldest historical tombs of Hyderabad, these tombs have been built using grey granite.
sources.shortName: 19 Hyderabad Monuments | Historical Monuments in Hyderabad

sources.snippet: Located just outside Golconda, these are the tombs of the Royalty of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. Most of the tombs have square raised bases and an arched corridor runs around them. They are mostly single or double-storey with huge bulbous domes at the top.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Hyderabad for the Travelling Architect -

places.name: Qutub Shahi Tombs

reviews.text: It's a great place to have a peaceful evening with friends and family. You can take lot of authentic photos. Try to visit during weekdays if you want to avoid the crowd. There are many historical evidence placed in the museum. You can learn something new if you're interested in Historical Construction.

The Qutub Shahi Tombs, nestled near Golconda Fort in Hyderabad, are a serene and beautiful historical site. These tombs, belonging to the Qutub Shahi dynasty, stand as remarkable examples of Islamic architecture, featuring grand domes, intricate carvings, and lush gardens. The atmosphere is calm, making it an ideal place for those who appreciate history or enjoy photography. With its well-maintained grounds and quiet ambiance, it's a peaceful retreat to explore the legacy of the past.

Timings:

Open daily: 9:30 AM to 5:30 PM

Closed on Mondays.

Entry Fee:

Adults: ‚Çπ20

Foreign Tourists: ‚Çπ100

Children: Free

The Qutub Shahi Tombs are a beautiful blend of Persian, Pathan, and Indian architecture, set amidst serene gardens. Each tomb tells a story of the dynasty that once ruled Hyderabad. The intricate stonework, grand domes, and tranquil surroundings make it a perfect place for history lovers and photographers. It's less crowded compared to other tourist spots, so you can take your time exploring. Visit in the early morning or evening for the best light and cooler weather.

places.address: Hyderabad, Telangana 500104, India

places.generalDescription: Birla Mandir, located in Hyderabad, offers a serene and peaceful atmosphere for visitors seeking solace from urban life. Constructed in 1976 by the Birla Foundation under the guidance of Swami Renganathananda from Ramakrishna Ashram, this Hindu temple is dedicated to Lord Venkateshwara of Tirumala. The inner shrine houses an 11ft tall replica of Tirupati Venkateswara and boasts stunning architectural designs.

sources.snippet: The Birla Mandir is a Hindu temple located on a hilltop, the temple is dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, a form of Lord Vishnu. The temple is made of white marble and it‚Äôs an excellent example of South Indian architecture. The temple is adorned with several
sources.shortName: Famous Buildings in Hyderabad: A Guide to the City‚Äôs Iconic Structures | by Kunal Pardeshi

places.name: birla mandir

reviews.text:
The temple is built entirely of white marble, exuding an aura of purity and elegance. Its intricate carvings and sculptures, depicting scenes from Hindu mythology, are a testament to the craftsmanship of its builders. The temple's architecture is a blend of traditional Indian and modern styles, creating a unique and captivating visual experience.
The temple complex is well-maintained and offers a variety of facilities for visitors. There are ample parking spaces, and a gift shop where you can purchase religious souvenirs. Visitors from all over India as well as foreigners Comes to see this Birla temple. The temple is also wheelchair accessible, making it inclusive for all visitors. Camera  is not allowed to the visitors to take in the Main Mandir. Most  beautiful and white Marble made by the " Birla" family.

Great Temple. The view of the hussian Sagar Lake from the upper part of the temple is breathtaking. It is better during the sunset time. You can also view the new government house from the temple. The temple is fully made of white marble cutting a hill. Outside there is a store also. Shoes and mobiles are not allowed inside. You can keep them outside free of cost. One of the must visit places in Hyderabad.

The place that instilled devotion into our heart, when we were at HYD just for a vacation.

Nice pleace where we get a peaceful spiritual ambience binded with the birds eye, scenic view of HYD.

After a pleasant prayer and pradikshana, when you get down and see the view you can simply cross mark some of the places in the bucket list at HYD üòÅ

Don't forget to buy Laddu prasada from the adjoining building !

reviews.text: Very good service. It was prompt and efficient.  Rate is okay. Access to office staff would have made it excellent. Customer needs to know the charges, document requirements etc before service is provided. The weight is rounded as in my case the weight was 8.5 kgs but charges collected were for 9 kgs. I think it is unfair. However, but for this, the service is good.

I recently used Just Xpress Courier Service for a package from India and was thoroughly impressed. They came to our home for pickup, helped with packing, and handled everything very professionally. The package arrived in just 4 days, which was much faster than expected. Great communication, reliable service, and smooth overall experience. Highly recommended!

Excellent service! Sent a parcel to my daughter in Canada and it arrived on time and in perfect condition. The staff was helpful and professional throughout the process. Highly recommend this shipping company for international deliveries!

places.name: GS STUDIO DESIGN CONSULTANTS

reviews.text:
We had a very good experience with Mr. Srikanth and his team.
- All the feedback during design is taken care of and incorporated immediately in the 3D drawings.
- The final product delivered is as shown in the initial design with no deviations whatsoever.
- Some of the shortcomings in the kitchen (east-facing apartment) were handled very well in the design and we are very happy with the final result especially with our kitchen and bedroom/office space.

Overall, it was a very good experience with timely delivery of the promised design.
Highly recommend!!!

Srikanth designs are very impressive and is very professional in executing them. He is very punctual and takes time to review designs , and updates designs based on our feedback. He is easy to work with and very flexible with project execution. He went above and beyond to make sure we are happy with the out come. I highly recommend him.We worked with him for our apartment and recently with our Villa, both came out really good

While looking for  an architect to design our project,  amongst many architects, for some reason we chose GS Studios. What followed was a close interaction, timely support and hold: Excellent desings and finest elevations, with detailing to the last T. Our firm then had another opportunity to undertake a turnkey project. The promoters of the project had designs sent by most reputed architects. However, the designs finalized by GS Studio were very much liked. In six months, we were able to complete the project, ahead of schedule, thanks to the timely support rendered by GS Studio.
As they say, no single individual is better than a team, here we are. We had a team of engineers supporting us timely and their principal architect was always willing to help us with suggestions that would save us time and cost.
All in all, GS Studio has all the ingredients to make some of the finest architects from the states of TN & AP and their works are well recommended for anyone interested in unique design concepts

places.generalDescription: Paigah Tombs, also known as Maqhbara Shams al-Umara, is a historical compound in Hyderabad that serves as the resting place for members of the Paigah family. These nobles were loyal patrons to the Nizams and held positions as statespeople, benefactors, and commanders. The tombs are renowned for their remarkable architecture made of lime and mortar, adorned with intricate marble carvings featuring floral designs and elaborate patterns.

sources.snippet: Spread across an area of 30-40 acres, Paigah Tombs are a marvelous piece of artistry on marble. These tombs belong to the noble families of Paigah who were loyal to Nizams and served as state‚Äôs people and generals. The tombs are a major architectural attraction due to the excellent craftsmanship, beautifully inlaid marble carvings and mosaic tile work.
sources.shortName: 12 Top Historical Places in Hyderabad with Location & Timings

sources.snippet: Built by one of the most influential families of the Hyderabad, after the Nizams, the Paigah Tombs were built by the Paigah family. Intricately constructed these tombs are among the best of the monuments in Hyderabad. If the mosaic tiles are the heart of the place, the skillfully carved marble facades act as the soul.
sources.shortName: 19 Hyderabad Monuments | Historical Monuments in Hyderabad

places.name: Paigah Tombs
places.address: Owaisi Nagar, Hasnabad, Santosh Nagar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500059, India

places.generalDescription: Charminar is a must-visit attraction in Hyderabad, offering an affordable market experience every Sunday. The bazaar reflects the Nizami influence of the city and provides a unique shopping and culinary experience reminiscent of old-world markets like Chandni Chowk in Delhi. It's a great place to shop and indulge in street food while immersing yourself in the local culture.

sources.snippet: This is the most famous monument in the city when one talks about Hyderabad, one talks about Charminar. As the name suggests, Charminar has four minarets about 48.5M high and is built out of granite, limestone, and mortar. It stands majestically tall amidst the colorful bangle shops in the labyrinth of Laad Bazaar of the old city and presents a stunning dazzling sight after nightfall.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Hyderabad for the Travelling Architect -

sources.snippet: One of the most popular historical monuments in Hyderabad, the Charminar was built by Mohammed Quli Qutub Shah in the year 1951. Made of granite and lime mortar, the structure depicts the indo- Arabian architecture. It is this monument which has come to symbolize the city of Hyderabad.
sources.shortName: 19 Hyderabad Monuments | Historical Monuments in Hyderabad

sources.snippet: The Charminar, also known as built in 1591 CE, is a monument and mosque located in Hyderabad, Telangana, India. The landmark has become a global icon of Hyderabad, listed among the most recognized structures of India. The Charminar is situated on the east bank of Musi river.
sources.shortName: Hyderabad Architecture | List of Famous Hyderabad Buildings and Landmarks

sources.snippet: This monument was constructed in 1591 under the Qutb Shahi Dynasty. Charminar actually means four towers. The structure has 4 towers or minarets which have domes over it and has a spiral staircase which leads you to the upper floors of the structure.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Historic Places & Monuments in Hyderabad

places.name: Charminar
